title: South Korea central bank chief says ready for rapid Fed rate hikes
text: February 20, 2018 / 11:36 PM / Updated an hour ago South Korea central bank chief says ready for rapid Fed rate hikes Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SEOUL (Reuters) - South Korea’s central bank chief said on Wednesday the Bank of Korea is prepared to respond to any negative impact from faster-than-expected policy tightening in the U.S. “If (the Fed moves) faster than expected, it will immediately impact international financial markets and also domestic markets as well, so we’re prepared to respond to such a scenario,” Governor Lee Ju-yeol told reporters in Zurich after signing a bilateral currency swap with Switzerland. Lee said the Bank of Korea expects the U.S. Federal Reserve to raise policy rates three times this year. One of the headwinds for South Korea’s economy this year is U.S. protectionist moves against South Korean exporters, Lee added. Reporting by Cynthia Kim; Editing by Eric Meijer
